treatment.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Cichorieae;genus Crepis;species runcinata;subspecies hallii;
treatment.description: Plants 20–60 cm. Leaves: petioles narrowly winged; blades oblan-ceolate or narrowly obovate, 1.5–3 cm wide, margins coarsely dentate or pinnately lobed (teeth not prominently white-tipped), faces glabrous (glaucous). Heads 5–14. Involucres 9–13 mm. Phyllaries lanceolate, apices acute, faces strongly stipitate-glandular. Cypselae chestnut brown, 4.5–6.5 mm, narrowed, not beaked; pappi 6–7 mm. 2n = 22

habitat_info.text: moist alkaline meadows , seeps , valley bottoms ;

treatment.discussion: Subspecies hallii is similar to subsp. runcinata, differing mainly in the dentate leaf margins. It differs from subsp. glauca mainly in having stipitate-glandular phyllaries.
